glsa.title: ClamAV: Multiple Denials of Service
glsa.synopsis: ClamAV contains several vulnerabilities leading to a Denial of Service.

background.p: ClamAV is a GPL virus scanner.

description.p: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in ClamAV by various researchers:

ul.li: Victor Stinner (INL) discovered that the OLE2 parser may enter in an infinite loop (CVE-2007-2650).
A boundary error was also reported by an anonymous researcher in the file unsp.c, which might lead to a buffer overflow (CVE-2007-3023).
The file unrar.c contains a heap-based buffer overflow via a modified vm_codesize value from a RAR file (CVE-2007-3123).
The RAR parsing engine can be bypassed via a RAR file with a header flag value of 10 (CVE-2007-3122).
The cli_gentempstream() function from clamdscan creates temporary files with insecure permissions (CVE-2007-3024).

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted file to the scanner, possibly triggering one of the vulnerabilities. The two buffer overflows are reported to only cause Denial of Service. This would lead to a Denial of Service by CPU consumption or a crash of the scanner. The insecure temporary file creation vulnerability could be used by a local user to access sensitive data.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
